required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Holmium and Thulium Lasers With Ureteroscopy for Urinary Lithiasis
clinical_study.official_title: Ureteroscopy for Upper Tract Lithiasis : Comparison of Costs and Effectiveness of Both Holmium and Thulium Lasers, in a Prospective Monocentric Study.

brief_summary.textblock:
Holmium laser is the current gold standard for lithotripsy on urinary lithiasis, while Thulium is brand new. The latter has been released in July 2020 in Europe, and only in-vitro studies have been published.
The aim of this study is to compare the stone free rate in ureteroscopy, for all consecutive patients treated with laser fragmentation, between both Holmium and Thulium lasers.
The costs and complications will also be studied.

primary_outcome.description: Urinary tract echography or renal computer tomography imaging. Patients with residual fragments under 4 mm are stone free.

secondary_outcome.description: Recording data about ureteric perforation and bleeding

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to three months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Recording data according to the Clavien classification (rates of hospitalisation, pain, infection and surgical revision)

arm_group.description: Stone fragmentation are performed with Holmium laser in ureteroscopy
Stone fragmentation are performed with Thulium laser in ureteroscopy

intervention.intervention_name: Ureteroscopy for upper tract stone treatment with Holmium laser
intervention.description: Rigid or flexible ureteroscopy for ureteral or renal stone. Lithotripsy with Holmium laser

intervention.intervention_name: Ureteroscopy for upper tract stone treatment with Thulium laser
intervention.description: Rigid or flexible ureteroscopy for ureteral or renal stone. Lithotripsy with Thulium laser

study_pop.textblock: Patients who are scheduled for ureteroscopy on renal or ureteral stones, which have been previously confirmed by tomography

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- renal ou ureteral stone confirmed by an abdominal and pelvic computed tomography
- treatment with rigid or flexible ureteroscopy
- laser lithotripsy during the procedure
- bacteriological examination of urine (sterile, bacterial colonization or treated by antibiotics)
Exclusion Criteria:
- non-use of laser for stone lithotripsy
- pregnant women
- under 18 years old
- refusal to give informed consent
- urinary malformation

reference.citation: Panthier F, Doizi S, Corrales M, Traxer O. Pulsed lasers and endocorporeal laser lithotripsy. Prog Urol. 2021 Jun-Jul;31(8-9):451-457. doi: 10.1016/j.purol.2020.11.008. Epub 2021 Jan 28.

Martov AG, Ergakov DV, Guseinov MA, Andronov AS, Dutov SV, Vinnichenko VA, Kovalenko AA. [Initial experience in clinical application of thulium laser contact lithotripsy for transurethral treatment of urolithiasis]. Urologiia. 2018 Mar;(1):112-120. Russian.

Rapoport LM, Vinarov AZ, Sorokin NI, Dymov AM, Enikeev DV, Tsarichenko DG, Lekarev VY, Klimov RE, Andreeva VA, Kovalenko AA. [Experimental verification of thulium lithotripsy]. Urologiia. 2018 Dec;(5):74-80. Russian.
